intro: Lippia rhodocnemis, commonly known as the red-stemmed lippia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often glandular and hairy. Its small, tubular flowers are usually clustered in spikes and can range in color from white to pink. Lippia rhodocnemis is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils due to its aromatic properties.
